location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Newnham, Secretary to the Government, Bombay, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Acting Resident, Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter asks Bruce to report when he expects to clear all the remaining goods from the warehouse at Bushire. Includes a letter, dated 28 February 1811, from John Elphinstone [Elphinston], Accountant General, Bombay, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, regarding the value and date of a consignment of woollen goods stored in the warehouse at Bussora [Basra]. The goods are described as being the remains of a consignment that was sent from Bushire during the period of unrest in August 1808.
